title: FBI: Xaxis

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau investigative records that possibly exist that reference Xaxis LLC. Of particular interest would be documents related to Xaxis that were created as a result of the investigation of Yevgeny Prigozhin's Internet Research Agency or into Prigozhin's Concord Management and Consulting organization. Please conduct a search for investigative records involving the utilization of Xaxis services and the spread of Russian propaganda and influence operations that targeted the United States both before, during and after the 2016 Presidential Elections. Please do not limit the scope of this request to only Xaxis and Russian influence campaign investigations, please conduct a full search for all bureau investigative records into Xaxis. 

Approximate time range of the documents would be from the date of the founding of Xaxis on June 27th, 2011 to when the Xaxis company name was abandoned in January 2024. 

Here's a news article detailing how Xaxis.com was "sunset" as a company/brand and folded in GroupM in January 2024:

https://www.campaignasia.com/article/groupm-sunsets-xaxis-sightline-and-finecast-brands-as-nexus-reorganises/491642

Here's a Crunchbase page that documented the company:

https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/xaxis

If Xaxis, or it's parent company GroupM are currently under Bureau investigation, please do not deny the entire request and release any information available under the law. If you cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the Bureau's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you on this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: ADH 2022 Cost Report FOIA

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: ADH 2022 Cost Report FOIA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to M.G.L. c. 66, § 10, please provide all submitted Adult Day Health (ADH) provider cost report filings from fiscal year 2022 pursuant to 957 CMR 6.00, including all:

·         The FY2022 AFC Cost Report Templates

·         FY2022 Financial Statements

·         Statement of Certifications

I recognize that you may charge reasonable costs for copies, as well as for personnel time needed to comply with this request.

The Public Records Law requires you to provide me with a written response within 10 business days. If you cannot comply with my request, you are statutorily required to provide an explanation in writing.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beacon

title: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Alpine County

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Unidentified Deceased Persons Information - Alpine County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information regarding the total number of active unidentified deceased persons cases ("John Doe" or "Jane Doe" cases) that the Alpine County Sheriff's Office is currently responsible for, dating from the earliest possible case on record, to the active case opened the closest of the date that this request is received.

Sheriff Tom Minder is both Sheriff and Coroner: https://www.alpinecountyca.gov/204/Sheriff

Please conduct the broadest possible search for any information (excel files, PowerPoint Presentations, Word documents, PDFs, email correspondence with the DOJ's NamUs program, CJIS correspondence, NCIC correspondence, etc.) that would help to definitively state the total number of unidentified deceased persons that the Alpine County Sheirff's Office is responsible for. If the number is zero as of the date the this request is received, then publicly state this. 

I research missing and unidentified person cases as a hobby, and I am curious to know if California's smallest county has any active unidentified deceased cases. 

Thank you for the Alpine County Sheriff's Office for their commitment to transparency, and I look forward to learning this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: 1880 Industrial Road Process of Zoning and Permit Approval

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent with the following text strings anywhere in the body or subject line, partial or complete:

1 - "1880 Industrial"
2 - "1880 Industrial Road" or "1880 Industrial Rd" or "1880 Industrial Way"
3 - "LePew"
4 - "Le Pew"
5 - "5611-232-02-014" (parcel number)

Include any correspondence from within City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc'd: or any other emails.

Please aggregate by the five categories and provide me the following information for all emails sent or cc'd into the City's emails from Jan. 1 2021 to the present to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts to include:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject


Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney, and to expedite the request. 

I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format. PDF is not preferred, and seems to have issues displaying the entire fields.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly.
2a. The economic information for this judgment comes from the submission done by myself of Kauffman Indicators of Entrepreneurship for Montezuma County in comparison to many surrounding counties in Utah, New Mexico, and Colorado. As seen in page 8 of the enclosed and publicly presented documents August 22, 2023, Montezuma County has compensation ranking at 39.27% within the Kaufmann Entrepreneurial Jobs Indicators, meaning that the policy taken by Cortez brings it into direct conflict with the interests of the people they impact should they price these or other electronic documents at a punitive rate.
2b. Because these documents are of the public interest, and the population is demonstrably disadvantaged, the policies of Cortez which require hundreds or thousands of dollars to achieve transparency could be construed poorly in civil proceedings, meaning that legal fees could ensue which would further penalize City of Cortez budgets. This is not my intent, therefore I state it up front that the best course of action would be to ensure that FOIA costs are not borne as specified.
3. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter
---------

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

title: 1880 Industrial Road Owned by City Employee Dona Thompson - Irregular Process for Permitting

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent To, From, CC, or BCC the following accounts:

dthompson@cortezco.gov

Include any correspondence from within City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc'd: or any other emails corresponding to this individual including 

Please provide me the following information for all emails sent or cc'd into the City's emails from Jan. 1 2021 to the present to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney, and to expedite the request. 

I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly.
2a. The economic information for this judgment comes from the submission done by myself of Kauffman Indicators of Entrepreneurship for Montezuma County in comparison to many surrounding counties in Utah, New Mexico, and Colorado. As seen in page 8 of the enclosed and publicly presented documents August 22, 2023, Montezuma County has compensation ranking at 39.27% within the Kaufmann Entrepreneurial Jobs Indicators, meaning that the policy taken by Cortez brings it into direct conflict with the interests of the people they impact should they price these or other electronic documents at a punitive rate.
2b. Because these documents are of the public interest, and the population is demonstrably disadvantaged, the policies of Cortez which require hundreds or thousands of dollars to achieve transparency could be construed poorly in civil proceedings, meaning that legal fees could ensue which would further penalize City of Cortez budgets. This is not my intent, therefore I state it up front that the best course of action would be to ensure that FOIA costs are not borne as specified.
3. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter
---------

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

title: FOIA -Covert surveillance programs, Counterintelligence Operations and Domestic Intelligence Activities (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This FOIA request, submitted by Evan L Rees, seeks access to documents related to covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, and domestic intelligence activities conducted by [Name of Government Agency] that may be synonymous with or reminiscent of tactics employed in historical programs such as COINTELPRO and MK Ultra. Specifically, this request aims to obtain records pertaining to activities that could be colloquially referred to as "Cointelpro 2.0" or any other covert programs undertaken by the agency involving surveillance, infiltration, disruption, or manipulation of individuals or groups within the United States.

Documents of interest include, but are not limited to:

1. Internal memoranda, directives, and communications discussing the planning, execution, and objectives of such covert operations, including any references to MK Ultra or similar programs.
2. Operational plans, strategies, and guidelines governing the conduct of surveillance and intelligence-gathering activities, including any involvement or coordination with community policing initiatives.
3. Records of surveillance operations, including logs, reports, and warrants obtained for monitoring targeted individuals or groups, including any watch lists or databases used for tracking.
4. Intelligence reports, assessments, and analyses generated as a result of surveillance and infiltration efforts, including any assessments related to private contractors involved in intelligence activities.
5. Training materials, manuals, and protocols used to educate personnel involved in covert operations, including any materials related to community alerts or coordination with neighborhood watch groups.
6. Budgetary documents related to the funding and allocation of resources for covert surveillance and intelligence activities.
7. Legal opinions, guidance, and interpretations concerning the legality and oversight of covert programs.
8. After-action reports, evaluations, and assessments conducted to review the effectiveness and impact of covert operations.

This request also encompasses documents related to activities synonymous with or related to "Cointelpro 2.0," including but not limited to covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, undercover investigations, disruption programs, counterterrorism measures, covert infiltration tactics, political surveillance programs, coercive intelligence operations, and national security investigations.

Please process this request specifically for Evan L Rees, as the documents sought are requested in relation to myself.

I am specifically requesting expedited processing of this request, as the information sought is of timely and significant public interest.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Evan L Rees

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Evan L Rees

communications.subject: FOIA Acknowledgement 2024-F-07322
communications.communication:
Hello:

This acknowledges the receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request, in which you requested access to FBI files on Cesar Chavez.

Your request was received in our office on 3/25/24 and assigned FOIA tracking number 2024-F-07322.


This letter is to inform you the Office of the Secretary is unable to respond to your request within the time limits established by the FOIA. Our ability to process your request is delayed because we are experiencing a backlog of requests. Please be advised, however, that your request is being handled as equitably as possible and that all documents that can be released will be made available at the earliest possible date. We will keep you informed of our progress. We expect to complete processing your request on or before 40 days from the date of this acknowledgment.

The Department of Labor has transitioned to a new data platform and the interface of the FOIA Portal has changed. By using the tracking number above, you may track the status of your FOIA request online at https://efoia.dol.gov/app/CheckStatus.aspx. Case files numbers must be entered exactly as provided. For example, FOIAXpress assigns alpha numeric tracking numbers (2020-F-00001), while SIMS-FOIA assigns six digit tracking numbers (887686). If you have been assigned an SIMS-FOIA tracking number, you can check the status of your FOIA request by clicking on the "legacy case search portal<https://www.dol.gov/foia>" link.
If you need to contact OSEC about it for any reason, please submit your inquiry via email at OSEC-FOIA@DOL.GOV<mailto:OSEC-FOIA@DOL.GOV>. In addition, it would be helpful to include the tracking number in the Subject line of any submission made.

Sincerely,


Carmelita Lambros
Office of the Secretary
U.S. Department of Labor
Office: (202)693-6048

title: Jean Maria Arrigo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jean Maria Arrigo
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Jean Maria Arrigo. She was born on April 30, 1944, in Memphis, Tennessee, USA. She died on February 24, 2024.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

Dr. Arrigo was a psychologist who blew the whistle on her profession’s secret ties to the torture and abuse of war-on- terror detainees, helping expose collusion between American Psychological Association officials and Defense Department leaders after the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001.

PROOF OF DEATH

Dr. Arrigo’s news obituary from the Washington Post is attached.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH

Please conduct a cross-reference search of your files on the following people and organizations to see if they contain additional records related to Dr. Arrigo:

(1) American Psychological Association
(2) Coalition for an Ethical Psychology

FEES 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you anticipate that those fees will exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: Your City of Sausalito public records request #24-27 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Sausalito ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-27 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for your request. Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, Government Code Section 7920.000, et seq., (the “Act”), this is to confirm receipt of your request for records you sent to the City of Sausalito (“The City”).   Under Government Code 7922.535, the City has 10-days from the receipt of the request, to make a determination as to whether it possesses responsive records, unless there is a basis for an extension. You may email CityClerk@sausalito.gov if you have not received any response from the City after 10 days of submitting your request. Please note that the Public Records Act, the City is under no obligation to create or produce records that do not already exist at the time of request. The City will not produce records that are not subject to disclosure under the Public Records Act, and may redact records to protect non-disclosable information. If the City determines it is in possession of disclosable public records, the records will be provided electronically free of charge. Request for paper copies of releasable public record must be accompanied by fees to cover copying cost at $0.25 per page. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Sausalito.

title: Personnel Evaluations related to Building & Code Administration officials (Volusia County, Florida Human Resources)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act request pursuant to Florida Sunshine Law.  

I hereby request the below information for the following Volusia County Building & Code Administration personnel: Kerry Leuzinger, Paul Traider, and Jeff Bergman.

1) Performance evaluations and/or employee reviews for the past 36 months
2) Employer memos, notes and reports from employee's performance evaluations for the past 36 months
3) Write-ups of any internal or external employee disputes filed in the past 36 months.
4) Any complaints or disputes filed or reported via phone, email, letter or other means of communication regarding the employee's conduct during the past 36 months.
5) Videotape or phone video recordings of official activity while in public view during the course of work during the past 36 months.
6) Drug screenings and results, including requests for drug screenings not voluntarily undertaken, for the past during the past 36 months.
7) Mental health evaluations conducted within the past 36 months.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge, processed by a representative of the news media/press, and is not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

I would prefer the request be filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Should my request be refused, kindly provide the specific legislative citation for the rejection, as required by Section 119.07(1)(d) of the Florida Statutes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within a reasonable time frame, according to Section 119.07(1)(a),(c) of the Florida Statutes.

Sincerely,

Lourdes Gonzalez

title: Sounds Of New York City (SONYC) documentation

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for documentation related to the Sounds of New York City (SONYC) noise sensors and their management. Specifically, I am interested in any technology documentation (including but not limited to manuals, tutorials, or presentations) on how the sensors detect noises. As well as any enforcement documentation (including but not limited to policies, plans, or memorandums) on how noise data is stored and shared with the Department of Environmental Protection (and any other NY agencies including NYPD) for noise violation enforcement.

To help you locate your relevant records, here is public documentation online that this tool was designed by the design firm Loft LLC (now Nova and Loft Designs) and paid for with a $5 mil NSF grant. See the documentation below.

* https://www.nyc.gov/assets/ddc/downloads/town-and-gown/SONYC.2%20Precis.FINAL.pdf
* https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1544753

I am a researcher looking to better understand how data informs strategic noise enforcement in NYC. I would appreciate these results as soon as possible and am happy to receive records on a rolling basis as they are made available. I am happy to discuss in more detail what I am looking for if helpful at rebecca@rebeccawilliams.info

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: Login.gov Cost Estimator Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Login.gov Cost Estimator Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request for all documentation related to estimating costs for state partners procuring Login.gov services from Feb 18, 2021 - present.

For your reference the Login.gov state and local partnership program was announced here: https://www.gsa.gov/blog/2021/02/18/logingov-to-provide-authentication-and-identity-proofing-services-to-a-limited-number-of-federally-funded-state-and-local-government-programs and a description of how states and local partners can pursue purchasing the Login.gov services according to a cost estimator is described here: https://www.login.gov/partners/state-and-local/#intergovernmental-cooperation-act-igca-process. 

Specifically, I am requesting the following type of records: 
- Any documentation on the cost estimator criteria;
- Any records, such as emails, from states or local governments requesting to use the cost estimator; 
- Any presentations or memos related to the revenue of the state and local partnership program.

These records will be used to inform research on digital identity best practices. Because of our not-for-profit status and the fact that this request is about a matter in the public interest, I request a fee waiver. If you have any questions or would like to discuss narrowing the request, please contact me directly at rebecca@rebeccawilliams.info.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: Records related to new software for AB481 data collection

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, including emails and attachments of RPD staff, purchase orders and contracts, for Richmond's use or acquisition of software or other systems designed to register data on the use of military equipment by law enforcement agencies in California. 

On February 5, 2024, in a community engagement meeting presented by the Richmond Police Department, Captain John Lopez stated that "there's new software now that just come out that's for law enforcement in order to collect AB481. Because this is not just specific to Richmond, it's for all you know all law enforcement agencies within California... I've been uh talking to a lot of other departments about how they've been collecting the data and collecting the stuff they need for their reports." See https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1lfwodFVIs at minute: 50:51. 

We are seeking records that shed light on the software, and record keeping systems that Captain Lopez referenced, what types of data they are designed to collect, and the providers and costs of such systems.

If you have any questions regarding this request, please don't hesitate to reach out to me directly, at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Yonkers PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on March 22, 2024. The request was for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Yonkers Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer
